alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 4:49PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Chester, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Bensley, Bellwood, Chesterfield Court House, East Highland Park, Lakeside, Laurel, Glen Allen, Chesterfield, Drewrys Bluff and Richmond Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
